body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth             Kids & Youth       Here you'll find information on all the programs we have available for kids, whether you are just in Hawaii for a week and looking for a way to interest your child in the history of Pearl Harbor, or you have a group of Boy or Girl Scouts that you want to bring to the monument!         Junior Ranger Scavenger Hunt  The WWII Valor in the Pacific National Monument Junior Ranger program is designed to help children embrace and enjoy learning about history. The goal is to help them make meaningful connections during their visit to VALR, which is a definite change of pace from the other activities they are probably experiencing on their visit to Hawaii!         Keiki Ranger Activity Book   The Keiki Ranger Activity book is designed for kids ages 3-6. Here you'll find an online copy that's free to download.          Every Kid In A Park   "Every Kid In A Park" is a new youth initiative to get all 4th graders and their families to experience the places that are home to our country's natural treasures, rich history, and vibrant culture FREE OF CHARGE!            Scout Groups
title: World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument: Kids & Youth
